p: We used a machine learning method “maximum entropy algorithm” for modeling changes in species distribution (Phillips, Anderson, & Schapire, 2006; Phillips, Dudík, & Schapire, 2004). MaxEnt derives the probability distribution of species based on georeferenced occurrence records and environmental variables, and the output is continuous. It has advantages over other SDMs as it requires species presence‐only data, and both continuous and categorical variables can be used in MaxEnt (Baldwin, 2009). Recent studies have demonstrated MaxEnt's ability to accurately predict species distribution in a wide range of ecological and geographical regions (Araujo & Guisan, 2006; Elith et al., 2006; Merow, Smith, & Silander, 2013).
